title: ## Retrieval-Based Language Models: A Reading List
This list provides a diverse selection of articles on retrieval-based language models, covering various aspects like architecture, applications, and challenges
Dense Passage Retrieval for Open-Domain Question Answering**
- Facebook AI Research
Introduces dense passage retrieval (DPR) for open-domain question answering, using dense vector representations for both questions and passages
Real-Time Dense Passage Retrieval for Open-Domain Question Answering**
- Google AI
Presents a real-time dense passage retrieval system for open-domain question answering, achieving high accuracy and efficiency
- Google AI
Explores the use of retrieval-augmented generation for knowledge-intensive NLP tasks, combining retrieval and generation for improved performance
Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Knowledge-Based Summarization**
- Google AI
Introduces RAG, a retrieval-augmented generation model for knowledge-based summarization, leveraging external knowledge sources
Dense Passage Retrieval for Open-Domain Question Answering**
- Facebook AI Research
Introduces DPR, a dense passage retrieval system for open-domain question answering, using dense vector representations for both questions and passages
- Google AI
Provides a comprehensive overview of retrieval-augmented language models, discussing their architecture, applications, and challenges
Towards Open-Domain Question Answering with Dense Passage Retrieval**
Explores the potential of dense passage retrieval for open-domain question answering, demonstrating its effectiveness in retrieving relevant passages
Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Text Summarization**
- Google AI
Investigates the use of retrieval-augmented generation for text summarization, improving the quality and informativeness of summaries
Dense Passage Retrieval for Open-Domain Question Answering**
- Facebook AI Research
Introduces DPR, a dense passage retrieval system for open-domain question answering, using dense vector representations for both questions and passages
- Google AI
